snippet: The repeal of dozens of licenses for telecommunications networks was cheered by some and criticized by others.
abstract: The repeal of dozens of licenses for telecommunications networks was cheered by some and criticized by others.
lead_paragraph: India's Supreme Court on Thursday revoked the 122 telecom licenses issued by former telecom minister Andimuthu Raja in 2008. As Vikas Bajaj writes in The New York Times:

headline.main: Reactions to the Supreme Court Decision on 2G
